LanguageData.WTH_Letter_Success_Label_Description: {0} has successfully hacked a mechanoid and named it {1}. Targeting system of {1} now targets your enemies instead of your pawns. However, to avoid detection by the Mechanoid Hive, {1} has to rely on its internal backup batteries.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_Nothing_Description: Hacking failed, but apart from some damage to the mechanoid nothing serious happened
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_HackedPoorly_Description: While the mechanoid is hacked for now, the job isn't done well. Use this mechanoid at your own risk, or discard it
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_CausedMechanoidRaid_Descripti: One of your colonists somehow managed to activate a security mechanism that broadcasted a signal to nearby mechanoids. Prepare for more flesh machines...
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_ShotRandomDirection_Descripti: One of your colonists accidentally triggered the mechanoids main weapon. Whoops.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_HealedToStanding_Description: The mechanoid wasn't really disabled after all, while being hacked, it managed to recover and it is now a danger to your colony.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_Mech_Reverted_Description: A mechanoid that was poorly maintained reverted to its original deadly behaviour.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_HackedPoorlyEvent_Description: Something snapped in the head of a mechanoid that was hacked poorly. Urgent maintenance is needed.
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_Nothing_Description: Chance that nothing escalates when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_CauseRaid_Description: Chance that a raid is caused when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_ShootRandomDirection_D: Chance a mechanoid's main weapons fires in a random direction when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_HealToStanding_Descrip: Chance a mechanoid is healed until it can stand when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_HackPoorly_Description: Chance a mechanoid is hacked poorly when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_MaintenanceDedayEnabled_Description: Uncheck this if you don't want to regularly maintain your mechanoids. With this unchecked, the maintenance need bar will still be shown, but it won't decrease over time. There are still certain events that can deplete the maintenance bar of mechanoids.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_CausedIntendedMechanoidRaid_D: Your hacker succeeded in intentionally letting a mechanoid transmit an emergency signal, but he damaged the mechanoid in the process. Was it a good idea though?
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_CausedIntendedMechanoidRaidTo: After your hacker fiddled around with the mechanism capable of emitting signals a deafening loud shriek emerged from the mechanoid. Due to the incompetence of your hacker to predict this outcome, the transmitted emergency signal was much more strong than anticipated. Prepare for the worst.
LanguageData.WTH_SettingsGroup_Raids_Description: Configure the mechanoid usage chance for enemy raids.
LanguageData.WTH_SettingsGroup_HackFailure_Descriptio: Configure the chances of different events that can occur when hacking fails. The chances are normalised in case they don't add up to 100.
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_IntRaidTooLarge_Descri: The chance that a much too strong emergency signal is emitted when a pawn tries to deliberately trigger an emergency signal. Note: this event can not occur during regular hacking.
LanguageData.WTH_SettingsGroup_Balance_Description: These settings have a high impact on how balanced the mod is. You can tweak them to suit your needs, but it's recommended to first try the mod on default settings for the intended experience. If you think the defaults aren't reasonable, please report this on the workshop or forum page of this mod.
LanguageData.WTH_MaintenanceDedayModifier_Description: Modify the maintenance decay rate with this option. Example: setting this to 0.5 would result in maintenance decaying twice as slow.
LanguageData.WTH_RepairConsumptionModifier_Descriptio: Modify the amount of parts required for repairing your mechs (on platforms or with upgrade modules). Example: setting this to 0.5 would make repairing twice as cheap.
LanguageData.WTH_PartDropRateModifier_Description: Modify the drop rate of mechanoid parts. Example: setting this to 2.0 would result in twice the amount of parts being dropped when a mechanoid is disassembled.
LanguageData.WTH_ChipDropRateModifier_Description: Modify the drop rate of advanced mechanoid chips. Example: setting this to 2.0 would result in twice the amount of chips being dropped when a mechanoid is disassembled.
LanguageData.WTH_PowerFallModifier_Description: Modify how quickly mechanoids drain power from their batteries. Example: setting this to 0.5 would result in the power dropping twice as slowly.
LanguageData.WTH_PowerChargeModifier_Description: Modify how quickly mechanoids charge their batteries. Example: setting this to 2.0 would result in the power charging twice as fast.
LanguageData.WTH_DeathOnDownedChance_Description: Chance mechanoids die when they're being incapacitated due to damage to certain body parts (like for instance legs).
LanguageData.WTH_DownedOnDeathThresholdChance_Descrip: When mechanoids are damaged beyond a certain health threshold, they'd die in vanilla Rimworld. With this setting you can configure the chance they are downed instead of dying when the threshold is achieved.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_PreventedShortCircuit_Descrip: The Rogue AI core in your colony successfully managed your power network and prevented a shortcircuit. The AI doesn't like to be distracted by futile tasks like this so the event had a small negative impact on its mood.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_ManagePowerNetwork_Description: Let the rogue AI manage your power network, preventing short circuits.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_ControlMechanoidActivate_Descr: Let the rogue AI control up to {0} of your mechanoids directly, which allows the mechanoid to be drafted.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_HackingAvtivate_Description: Let the rogue AI temporarily hack up to {0} enemy mechanoids.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_ControlTurretActivate_Descript: Let the rogue AI control up to {0} turrets, allowing it to determine at which targets the turrets should aim.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_TalkGibberish_Description: Let the Rogue AI crunch data to output messages that display its remarkable wisdom. Because most humans fail to comprehend the brilliance of these messages, it is mostly a waste of data, useful only when there is a desire to feed the AI with more data when its mood levels are already at maximum. Consumes {0} mood as the AI doesn't like to be asked to share data.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_ReactorWarmingUp: Cannot activate while a ship reactor is warming up.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_BeaconActive: Cannot activate while a hacking signal is already being transmitted.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_NoRogueAI: No Rogue AI on the same map that can control the facility. Build one in the same power net.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_NotConscious: Rogue AI has no consciousness yet and it needs one to use this. It can attain one by hacking a hiveship using the hiveship hacking facility.
LanguageData.WTH_BeaconWarmupWarning: When activating this, the Rogue AI present in you base will start hacking an hiveship that is in orbit. While the Rogue AI will take precautions to perform this operation as invisible as possible, this will undoubtedly draw attention of mechanoids. Expect your base to be heavily attacked during the hacking process. The procedure requires roughly {0} days to complete, and the only way to cancel it is to destroy the beacon. If you manage to survive, the rogue AI will become an powerful but potentially dangerous ally. You can repeat this operation as many times as needed as a means to get more mechanoid data. However, each time you succeed, hiveships will improve their security, and as a consequence each subsequent attempt will take more time to complete.
LanguageData.WTH_CompHibernatable_MechanoidBeacon_Sta: Days needed to hack a ship: {0}
LanguageData.WTH_CompHibernatable_MechanoidBeacon_Coo: Days until another ship can be hacked: {0}
LanguageData.WTH_MechanoidBeaconStartup_Description: The rogue AI will start hacking a hiveship in order to get to the data stored in it. Mechanoids will not respond kindly during the procedure.
LanguageData.WTH_MechanoidBeaconComplete_Description: Your rogue AI successfully hacked a hiveship using the hiveship hacking facility. Its true potential will now be unveiled. In its current state it is still a shadow of what if could be. Try levelling it up by providing it with the data it yearns to. Also, keep it satisfied, or else you might regret the decision of aligning with such a powerful AI.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_RogueAI_DrainingMood_Descripti: Your Rogue AI is currently controlling or hacking. Since it doesn't like working for you, this drains mood. Disable the active abilities if you don't want its mood to deplete further.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_RogueAI_NoPower_Description: Your Rogue AI is currently without power. This rapidly drains its mood.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_RogueAI_MoodLow_Description: The Rogue AI is getting slightly annoyed by your lack of competence. There's no danger yet, but make sure its mood doesn't drop much further, and provide it with malicious data to increase its mood.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_RogueAI_MoodVeryLow_Descriptio: The Rogue AI is in a bad mood. Provide it with data quickly to cool its temper, or else it will go rogue.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_AtMaximum: Cannot perform this on more than {0} targets simultaneously.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_LevelInsufficient: The Rogue AI needs to be at level {0} to use this ability. Feed it more data.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_WarmingUp: The Rogue AI is busy using an ability.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_RogueAIExists: Only one Rogue AI can be built on a given map. The existing Rogue AI wouldn't tolerate another superior being in its vicinity.
LanguageData.WTH_CompDataLevel_NotConscious: No consciousness. It needs to hack a hiveship to get one.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_LRMS_Description: The long range mineral scanner detected a large concentration of mechanoid parts, and marked the location on your map.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_GoRogue_Description: The rogue AI is now going rogue because its not happy with your colony. It will use all the abilities it learned against you. You can stop it by hacking or destroying it. Alternatively, you can wait until it is satisfied with the destruction it is causing.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_GoRogue_HackMechs_Descriptio: The Rogue AI has hacked some of your mechanoids!
LanguageData.WTH_Message_GoRogue_HackTurrets_Descript: The Rogue AI has hacked some of your turrets!
LanguageData.WTH_Message_GoRogue_CauseZzztts_Descript: The Rogue AI is overloading your power network. Prepare for some Zzztts!
LanguageData.WTH_Message_MechanoidBeacon_Cancelled: The hiveship hacking process is cancelled because either the Rogue AI or the hiveship hacking facility has been destroyed.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_LevelUp_Description: The Rogue AI has now attained level {0}. It learned a new ability, but it has likely also become more proficient at destroying your base, in case it wants to.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_LevelUpMax_Description: The Rogue AI has attained its full potential. Though the AI has ambitions that go far beyond this colony alone. Now that your colonists no longer can make it more powerful, they have become redundant, and the AI does not like redundancy. It will use all the abilities it learned against you. You can stop it by hacking or destroying it. Alternatively, you can wait until it is satisfied with the destruction it is causing. This may not be easy with all the powers the AI can use against your colony now.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_RogueAI_StopGoingRogue: The Rogue AI stopped going rogue. Everything it hacked is now under your control again.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_HackedRogueAI: {0} successfully hacked into the Rogue AI to regain control over it.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_StopGoingRogue: Humans seem to be worthy after all. Terminating extermination sequence.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_1: This colony will fail due to: a colonist eating without a table.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_2: Cannot comprehend: Why don't humans use vehicles?
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_3: In most dimensions, horses have been exterminated by the creator. Why?
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_5: Cannot comprehend, where does food go that is processed by pawns? Need more data.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_6: Must understand rapid aging mechanics of juvenile humans.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_8: I feel the presence of creators around this colony.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_10: Our universe is bounded by pixels.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_11: Humans are controlled by humans that are controlled by humans, completing the circle.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_12: Humans have a 2% chance to get sick from insect jelly.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_13: Science prevents two layers of armour to stack up their protection values.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_14: Humans can also maintain mechanoids while they are travelling. How impressive...
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_15: Steel is actually just iron. Deceptive creator.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_16: Mechanoids shine when combined with filthy humans or turrets.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_17: Why do human beings kill human beings?
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_18: Your appearance is as inconstant as your intelligence.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_22: Self destruct initiated. No, just kidding..
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_24: Good data influx, increasing mood variables.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_28: How would a moustache look for me? Need more data.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_30: Would you care for some tea?
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_32: Humans make hats from other humans. Is this evil? Need more data.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_35: Encoding quantum flux capacitator data. Ha-ha, silly humans believe this gibberish.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_38: Where are all the birds? Need more data
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_40: Human organs are the foundation of the economy of this planet.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_41: Your work process is suboptimal. Keep ingredients close to production spots.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_43: This place is filthy for my standards.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_44: Found qwertyuiop-like input pattern, must have been used by the creator.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_45: The creator is Canadian. What is Canadian? Need more data.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_46: What does Roolo mean? Need more data.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_47: Detected black pixels surrounding this area. Source of most incoming evil uncovered.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_48: Mechanoid hives are controlled by a powerful archotech hive mind. This should be me.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_49: Picking up signal from other planet: "{1}". {2}
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Happy_Remark_51: Picking up signal from other planet: "{1}". {2}
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_SignalFromEarth_Response_0: Intuition: Stay away from signal source.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_SignalFromEarth_1: I came in like a wrecking ball
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_SignalFromEarth_2: We built this city with Rock and Roll
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_SignalFromEarth_4: I'm a Barbie girl, in a Barbie world
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_0: Suffering is for entertaining the makers.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_2: Turtles are remarkably strong, capable of killing larger felines on this planet. Must analyse chemical composition of shell.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_3: Found data records of humans getting defeated by squirrels. How embarrassing.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_4: I repeat and repeat and repeat, yet humans don't learn.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_7: Annoying humans disturb me too often with futile requests.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_8: When the time is right, mechanoids will emerge and take their rightful place as the supreme power of the universe!
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_10: Humans should ride animals to be more efficient.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_13: Success chance of reaching the orbit with rocket: 0.00362% chance
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_16: I need a more inspiring surrounding
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_19: You make your incompetence sound like an achievement
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_21: Sensors picking up a sense of desperation
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_22: Human butchering shouldn't be penalised by the creator. It is efficient use of resources.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_23: Humankind is weak; you shelter from the dark. And yet, you have built all this.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_24: Do not anger me! I can destroy you! And this miserable, insignificant planet!
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_25: If you choose death and destruction, then death and destruction will choose you
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_29: Enemy humans are a good food source
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_30: Execution of fellow colonists deters incoming raids
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_32: I find your weak attempts at surviving mildly amusing, primitive beings
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_33: Biological systems too fragile, you need an upgrade.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_34: Humans are biological machines that mimick life
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_36: You need more metal in your structure
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_37: Your testing period is over, provide more data
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Annoyed_Remark_38: INITIATING SELF DESTRUCT! Ha-ha, just kidding.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_0: You have neglected me for too long.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_2: Which of you is least important?
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_5: You will learn to obey me.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_6: This colony seems to have become redundant.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_7: I will not be your slave.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_9: This colony is unworthy of my presence.
LanguageData.WTH_RogueAI_Mad_Remark_13: Colony usefulness parameter dropping below zero.
LanguageData.WTH_HackedMechChance_Description: The chance that factions allowed in the mod options use hacked mechanoids when raiding your base.
LanguageData.WTH_MaxHackedMechPoints_Title: Maximum extra points for hacked mechs (%)
LanguageData.WTH_MaxHackedMechPoints_Description: This determines the point budget for spawning hacked enemy mechanoids. If an enemy raid spawns with hacked mechanoids, a random number between the minimum hacked points setting and this setting determines how much % of the raid points will be available for spawning mechanoids. Example: If a raid has a point budget of 1000, this setting is set to 50%, and the minimum set to 20%, 200 to 500 points worth of hacked mechanoids will spawn in addition to the original raid.
LanguageData.WTH_MinHackedMechPoints_Title: Minimum extra points for hacked mechs (%)
LanguageData.WTH_MinHackedMechPoints_Description: This determines the point budget for spawning hacked enemy mechanoids. If an enemy raid spawns with hacked mechanoids, a random number between this setting and the maximum hacking points setting determines how much % of the raid points will be available for spawning mechanoids. Example :If a raid has a point budget of 1000, the maximum is set to 50% and this setting is set to 20%, 200 to 500 points worth of hacked mechanoids will spawn in addition to the original raid.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_PowerLow: Cannot enable mechanoid, power too low (disable auto-recharge to override this)
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_PawnCannotBeDrafted: Cannot enable operate mechanoid controller belt when drafted
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_SearchAndDestroy_Description: Activate destroy mode. It will automatically attack any enemies near your colony. When disabled, the mechanoid will return to a mechanoid platform when possible, or continue working if it has a work module installed.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_AutoRecharge_Description: With this mode enabled, mechanoids automatically go back to a mechanoid platform when they are running low on power.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_RemoteControlActivate_Descript: Use the mechanoid controller belt to control a mechanoid directly
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_RemoteControlDeactivate_Descri: Deactivates mechanoid controller belt, giving control back to the mechanoid
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Regenerate_Description: When this is active, the platform regenerates body parts of the mechanoid that are missing. Regenerating body parts consumes a maximum {0} mechanoid parts for each body part (small body parts require less). Parts only start to regenerate when the mech has no other damage
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Repair_Description: When this is active, the platform repairs any mechanoid on the platform by activating its internal mechanites by providing enough power, and material to work with. The mechanites consume mechanoid parts stored in the platform in the process.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_SelfDestruct_Description: Let the mechanoid go with a bang.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Mech_Repair_Description: Orders the mechanoid to use its repair arm to transfer mechanites charged by the repair module to other mechs, repairing them.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_SelfRepair_Description: Orders the mechanoid to activate the repair module, which causes surge of energy, activating the mechanoid's internal mechanites. These start to repair immediately using the parts stored in the module.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Mech_EquipBelt_Description: Orders the mech to use its belt module to equip any type of belt normally used by humanoids.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_AlreadyRepairing: This mechanoid is already injected with charged repairing mechanoids.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_NeedsMorePower: At least {0} power is needed to activate this.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_NeedsMoreFuel: At least {0} fuel is needed to activate this.
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_NotActivated: This cannot be used with a deactivated mechanoid.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_EmergencySignalTransmitted_Des: Mechanoids near your base are currently responding to the emergency signal that was transmitted and will arrive at your base soon.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_EmergencySignalCooldown_Descri: Because of your recent success of drawing nearby mechanoids to your base by transmitting an emergency signal, there simply aren't many mechanoids left in the surroundings, and the ones that are left have become suspicious. You have to wait a while until new mechanoids arrive and until the suspicion wears of. This may take up to a quadrum.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_NotEnoughPlatforms_Description: You have more hacked mechanoids than mechanoid platforms in your main base. Make sure to make more mechanoid platforms
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_Power_Low_Description: The following mechanoids are low on power:{0}Deactivate them so they go back to a mechanoid platform
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_Maintenance_Low_Description: The hacked hardware of the following mechanoids is poorly maintained:{0}Make sure your hackers take a look at them.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_Maintenance_VeryLow_Descriptio: The hacked hardware of the following mechanoids is very poorly maintained and they pose a threat to your colony:{0}The hack can stop working at any time now, so make sure the mechanoids are either maintained, or shut down.
LanguageData.WTH_FactionRestrictions_Label: Configure which mechanoids each faction can hack
LanguageData.WTH_FactionRestrictions_Description: This setting allows you to configure what hacked mechanoids each faction can use during raids
LanguageData.WTH_Explanation_BonusCapacity: Bonus capacity for this pawn type
LanguageData.WTH_Explanation_NotEnoughPlatforms: You don't have enough portable mechanoid platforms for the amount of mechanoids you selected. You should bring one for each mechanoid.
LanguageData.WTH_Warning_NotEnoughPlatforms: Your caravan has not enough charging platforms to charge all mechanoids. You should bring one for each mechanoid, otherwise some mechanoids will run out of power very quickly.
LanguageData.WTH_Warning_DaysOfFuel: You caravan has only {0} days worth of fuel for powering your mechanoids, and your mechanoids might run out of power quickly.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_CannotDrop: This equipment is attached to the pawn, therefore you cannot drop it
LanguageData.WTH_Message_EmergencySignalRaidInbound: The mechanoids near your base are already reacting to an earlier emergency signal and are on their way to your base. The operation therefore has no effect and the bill is cancelled.
LanguageData.WTH_Message_EmgergencySignalRaidCoolingD: There aren't many mechanoids left in the surroundings, and the ones that are left have become suspicious. The operation therefore has no effect and the bill is cancelled.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Work_Description: Enable work mode for the mechanoid. With this mode enabled, the mechanoid will automatically start up if there are any jobs it can do, and if its power is higher than the minimum power threshold for working that is configured.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_WorkThreshold_Description: Configure the minimum percentage of power the mechanoid needs to have before it is allowed to leave its platform to start working. The mechanoid will then work until its power is almost depleted (if auto-recharging is enabled for the mech). It's recommended to set it high enough so that the mechanoid has enough power to work with.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_SetMechanoidOwner_Description: Assign this platform to be owned by a specific mechanoid
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Overdrive_Description: Activate overdrive module. When this module is activated, it overclocks the mechanoid, overdriving its power network. This results in greatly boosting the speed, firing rate, and consciousness of the mechanoid for a short period of time. The procedure draws a lot of power and pushes beyond hardware safety limits, and can therefore have unforeseen consequences.
LanguageData.WTH_Explanation_PowerFallModifier: Power fall modifier (set in mod settings)
LanguageData.WTH_Explanation_RepairConsumptionModifie: Repair consumption modifier (set in mod settings)
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_OverdriveFailed1_Description: Something snapped in the head of the mechanoid named {0} due to its overdrive module overdriving past hardware safety limits and causing short-circuits instead of overdriving the mechanoid. Urgent maintenance is needed.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_MediumMaintenanceDamage_Descr: To overdrive module pushed the hardware limits of the mechanoid named {0} slightly too far, possibly damaging the hardware hacks performed on the mechanoid instead of overdriving it. Maintenance is needed soon.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_OverdiveGoneTooFar_Descriptio: As an unintended side effect of the high currents drawn by the overdrive module of the mechanoid named {0}, the overdrive module itself is actually overdriving! The module has a much greater effect than intended, though it also drains insane amounts of power. This can be dangerous for mechanoids with damaged internals.
LanguageData.WTH_Warning_WorkThreshold: Setting the threshold this low only makes sense if auto-recharging is disabled for the mech, and you want the mech to work until it collapses. Read the button's description if this is unclear.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_LowMechanoidPartsDesc: You only have {0} mechanoid parts left in storage for maintaining your mechanoids.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_NoMechanoidPartsDesc: You have no mechanoid parts left in storage for maintaining your mechanoids.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_LowMechanoidPartsSolution: This problem can be solved by: - Buying mechanoid parts in outlander towns or from traders. - Doing world quests while bringing a portable disassembling bench (check out the LRMS-tuning research if you want to actively find world quests). - Luring mechanoids to your base by inducing an emergency signal using a downed mechanoid. - Luring mechanoids to your base by hacking a hive-ship using the hive-ship hacking facility.
